page.title: 11NW.SHERBORNE:OLD HOSPITAL
page.content: The{isolation hospital}is a derelict brick building standing on the west side of Trent Path Lane a mile out of Sherborne at OS ref 623173. It was used, up until the end of the last war, to isolate people suffering from {fevers}and highly{infectious diseases. There is one main building and two smaller buildings at its side. It can be reached by a sandy lane leading from the B3148 road. It would have had a{beautiful view}to the south, across the Sherborne valley to the hills beyond. It is now overgrown with stinging nettles, dog-roses and various other plants and flowers, and surrounded by young trees, mostly elder. There are signs that it is used from time to time by people{sleeping {rough.}
